articles.author: Alden GonzalezESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Dodger Stadium concession workers, pleased with progress in negotiations, won't strike around All-Star Game
articles.description: The concession stands will be staffed when Dodger Stadium hosts its first All-Star Game in 42 years, as the workers' union has agreed not to strike around the event amid progress in negotiations.
articles.content:
Dodger Stadium concession workers have relinquished plans for a strike during next week's All-Star Game after threatening to do so in an effort to secure higher wages.
In a joint statement Friday by… [+1336 chars]

articles.title: Houston Texans settle claims vs. team in relation to sexual misconduct allegations involving Deshaun Watson
articles.description: The Texans have settled all claims and intended claims against the organization in relation to sexual misconduct allegations against former quarterback Deshaun Watson, it was announced Friday.

articles.title: Tiger Woods misses cut after finishing the second round of the Open Championship 3-over
articles.description: In what is likely his final Open Championship at St. Andrews, Tiger Woods misses the cut after shooting 9-over through the first two rounds of the tournament.

articles.author: Tom HamiltonSenior Writer
articles.title: LIV Golf players, led by Dustin Johnson, finding success at The Open amid backlash for breaking away
articles.description: As the criticism continues for the breakaway LIV Golf series and its players, a number of them, including Dustin Johnson at 9 under, are finding success at The Open. Talor Gooch says the backlash has served to galvanize the new series' players.
articles.content:
ST. ANDREWS, Scotland -- The criticism leveled at the LIV Golf players by their peers and the sport's stakeholders has galvanized them at the 150th Open, according to Talor Gooch.

articles.title: USSF president Parlow-Cone Equal pay breakthrough lifts 'dark cloud' over U.S. soccer
articles.description: USSF president Cindy Parlow-Cone has told ESPN "a dark cloud has moved along" as equal pay was agreed with the men and women's national teams.

articles.title: WNBA star Brittney Griner back in Russian court as trial resumes
articles.description: Brittney Griner appeared in a Russian court as her trial resumed Friday. Her attorneys gave evidence that Griner had a medical exemption for cannabis use in the United States.
articles.content:
KHIMKI, Russia -- A lawyer for WNBA star Brittney Griner, who is jailed in Russia on drug charges, on Friday presented a court with a doctor's letter recommending she use cannabis to treat pain.

articles.title: Phoenix Suns match Indiana Pacers' 4-year, $133 million offer sheet to Deandre Ayton, agents say
articles.description: The Suns matched the Pacers' 4-year, $133 million offer sheet for restricted free agent center Deandre Ayton, clearing the way for him to return to the franchise, his agents, Bill Duffy and Nima Namakian, told ESPN.

articles.title: Agent Casey Close sues Fox Sports radio host Doug Gottlieb for libel over tweet about contract offer to Los Angeles Dodgers' Freddie Freeman
articles.description: Agent Casey Close sued Fox Sports radio host Doug Gottlieb for libel, alleging Gottlieb "falsely and recklessly" defamed Close with a tweet that claimed Close and his agency hadn't presented a contract offer to Freddie Freeman during free agency.
